title: Unsupervised Machine Learning Analysis for 4D-STEM Datasets
content: Newly designed electron detectors now operate at frame rates as high as 120 kHz. This technology directly underpins the 4D-STEM computational imaging approach, in which a focused probe is rastered over a sample and a two-dimensional diffraction pattern is collected at each probe location. Many 4D-STEM datasets are inherently multimodal, as a single dataset can be analyzed to produce maps of crystal orientation, strain, and other properties [1]. Since its inception, the 4D-STEM approach has skyrocketed in popularity, and is now increasingly applied to complex samples and in-situ data streams.
